website_summaries.verdict: The Urbanears Stadion's coiled design may not appeal to everyone, but a lot of people will find it liberating to be free of the dangling cords of most Bluetooth sports headphones.
pros: The Urbanears Stadion fits securely on your head, is comfortable to wear, and eliminates the dangling wires of other Bluetooth sports headphones (it works well for running)
It's sweat-proof, sounds decent enough, and includes a protective carrying pouch
cons: It's not good for listening in noisy environments, thanks to semi-open design of buds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Exercise Earbuds/Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought these for use on her Peloton (stationary exercise bike) and loves them. Originally she was worried she wouldn't like how they wrap around the back of the neck so tightly because she has long hair, but it doesn't interfere. Most importantly, the ear parts stay in place very well. Just a warning, for anyone with glasses these will most likely interfere with them since they go over your ears like glasses earpieces. Also, these are excellent quality, but if you have sticker-shock from the price, there are cheaper, lesser namebrand versions out there that are almost identical to these in appearance (don't know about the sound quality).
customer_reviews.author: C. PilotTop Contributor: Kayaking

customer_reviews.title: Better choices are available
customer_reviews.text: Headphones worked for 5 minutes then quit working. I contacted Urbanears customer support who made me send multiple emails with pictures before they would send out replacement headphones. Replacement headphones worked for one run then quit. I again contacted customer support at Urbanears and they would not grant refund, only product exchange. I contacted Amazon who then allowed me to ship headphones back with refund. Not impressive at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amy E.

customer_reviews.title: Wished they were better because I liked the design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I hate the bouncing cord on most Bluetooth headsets. This design intrigued me. I liked the fit and the comfort. I thought the buttons were easy to reach on the back of the head and the cord didn’t bounce. Unfortunately, function and performance didn’t match form. I wore them first on a five Mile run. The Bluetooth connection kept skipping out every few seconds with the phone in my pocket. Then, 3 miles in, the battery died after being charged fully prior. Despite me wanting them to be better, I returned these defective headphones for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Non de Plume

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, very functional.
customer_reviews.text: Really love these! The sound isn't the best, but for my purposes it's perfect. It is not noise-cancelling and this is good because it means I can actually listen to music and talk to people at the same time. This makes it safer for walking around and biking too. They're super comfortable once you figure out how to get them in the ears properly. My primary use so far is using them in the gym and for practicing yoga and they word perfect for both these activities.
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because there's nothing worse during a ran than constantly trying to jam your headphones back into your ears. These fit extremely well and the sound was excellent, but there's a flaw here that ruined the experience anyway: bluetooth connectivity. The music sounded like a CD that was constantly skipping. It was worse while running/moving and worse still if I held my cell phone by the edges. Next on the list of flaws are the controls, which are very small buttons spaced very close together. No matter which one I wanted to press, I always hit the power button. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: George C.

customer_reviews.title: great idea, flimsy execution
customer_reviews.text: Battery cover came off in my hand on the first try of opening it. Bluetooth stopped working on the second day - dropped out every minute or so with the phone 3 feet away (battery fully charged). Very comfortable to wear, but plastic parts are of poor quality
customer_reviews.author: druax

customer_reviews.title: Power button flaw renders them useless.
customer_reviews.text: Have had two sets of these things over a year. First one stopped working in less than two months, power button stopped working, couldn't turn them on. I was able to return them and get a new set even though I'd had them more than a month (Thanks Amazon!). This one sat on dresser for a few months while I used another set of headphones. Got around to using them again a couple months ago. Two days ago the same problem came up, power button will no longer turn them on. Expect more from a headset that costs nearly $100 than a couple months of acceptable usage before they are rendered inoperable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Rifkin

customer_reviews.title: Great fit but stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Easily the most comfortable running headphones I've ever worn. Unfortunately, only worked for three runs and then quit completely. The warranty replacement only lasted for two runs. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: David R Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent as long as they last
customer_reviews.text: I’m conflicted about what to write. I loved these headphones as long as they worked, but then, one year after I bought them, they just stopped working. The on/off button does not respond anymore. I charged them and the light went on, still I cannot switch them on. What a bummer. They are comfortable, let noise come through so they are great for running outdoor, they are light, but they just stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: nakiki

customer_reviews.title: ... are hard to review - the sound quality is excellent, and the physical design is amazing - these ...
customer_reviews.text: These are hard to review - the sound quality is excellent, and the physical design is amazing - these stay on through even my toughest runs and are extremely comfortable. The deal breaker for me: even paired with my phone in my arm-band, less than a foot away, there are continual skips and drops in connection, resulting an a lousy experience. It seems to correlate with 1. outdoor running in an urban environment and 2. sudden head-turns (a necessity when running on busy streets). I can use them easily in gym, but not out for a run. These could be great, but the inconsistency in audio isn't acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace the same system I have had for a few years. Works great at the gym or on the trail. Only issue is the power port cover. It is attached by a thin piece of rubber that will eventually tear free this allowing perspiration to enter the power port, which eventually renders them useless.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Ford

customer_reviews.title: Stay away, Died shortly after 12 months
customer_reviews.text: These are my third (and final) pair of Stadion headphones. A little after 12 months they stopped charging (like other reviewers say). I emailed UrbanEars customer support and they made me send them a laundry list of pictures and proof of purchase only to tell me that the warranty had run out on the item. They know full well from the reviews on this item that this item is defective, and dies a little after 12 months. Actually, after reading reviews I am lucky to have gotten 12 months out of these. Stay away from Stadion and stay away from Urban Ears. Their customer service is as poor as their products,
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Buttons stopped working within weeks
customer_reviews.text: The buttons in these headphones are awkward and hard to press. The rubber in them makes it hard to figure out whether you've pressed them or not. Eventually, the main button which is used to turn on and off the headphones stopped working and now I basically can't use these at all anymore. Construction quality overall is low, which is disappointing for headphones that sit comfortably in the mid-range of options when it comes to price.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 months. Won't hold a charge. Die after 30 mins of use.
customer_reviews.author: Lulugal$

customer_reviews.title: Works if the headphones are within 1 foot of your phone
customer_reviews.text: The setup and pairing process was straightforward but the audio drops frequently. I run with my phone in the pocket of my running shorts and apparently the 2-3 foot distance between the phone and the headphones is too far to maintain a consistent connection. Kind of disappointing for what these things cost.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as promised
customer_reviews.text: They work really well and they don't move around and they are comfortable. Took a bit to figure them out but once I did I can't really imagine using a different set. Bought a second pair for when I travel and work out.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa McSherry

customer_reviews.title: They actually stay in your ears.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for everything from listening to music to working out and even playing basketball. You can sweat in these like crazy and they won't fall out. You can shake your head like a dang dog and they won't come out. My only complaint is sometimes the connection cuts in and out. This has only happened when something was blocking them and when outside, especially if it's windy.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Ray Morford

customer_reviews.title: Lasts like 2 runs
customer_reviews.text: I've never written a review here but these things are the worst. I've been through 3 pairs and each one has lasted like 2 runs before breaking as others describe. It's because the units are not sealed and sit against your hair when you sweat so water gets in and shorts things out. At least Urbanears sends me free replacements but at this point I just want my money back (which they won't do). Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: ADW

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I actually liked the product design, it stayed in my ears well, sound quality was decent, and battery life was strong. I wish it had smart bluetooth to display how much battery life was left on my phone, and I wish it was easier to change songs (like double tapping volume instead of holding it down), but the product was decent. However, these headphones stopped working after 5 months, which is way too short for an $80 pair of headphones that were treated well - never went through the wash, never went out in the rain, charged regularly, etc. I'll update the review after contacting the company.
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I returned these. Flimsy and they fell out of my ears
customer_reviews.author: Anne Browning

customer_reviews.title: Good Price, spotty bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is well designed as sturdy wireless headset for exercise. Good value for the price. Only problem I have had is depending upon the environment the bluetooth connection seems to susceptible to a lot of interference.
customer_reviews.author: dendron

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for working out
customer_reviews.text: These were great for about a month. It took a minute to figure out how they fit and after that I liked them a lot. Yesterday one speaker glitched out. I've done my best to set to default the earbuds. Nothing doing. Less than a month of use and now useless. I'd purchase these again but I can't afford the limited use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until they didn't work...
customer_reviews.text: Less than a month after support window closed they just stopped working. Plug them in and the light goes immediately from red to white. Unplug them and try to use them and they won't turn on. VERY disappointing for the price point, I would suggest avoiding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: Love these. But note first pair failed within 30 days - would not take a charge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worst Ever !!!! HORRIBLE SOUND.
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE!!!! WORST HEADPHONES UVE EVER HAD. THE SOUND IS VERY VERY VERY LOW. THE FACT THAT THE VOLUME IS TURNED UP MAX AND I HEAR PEOPLE TALKING THIRTY FEET AWAY IS A JOKE. DO NOT BUY THESE. REFUND ME RIGHT NOW.
customer_reviews.author: tim bitici

customer_reviews.title: One of the better workout headphones available
customer_reviews.text: Amazing for the gym, no cords hanging down on the shoulder which is annoying when running. The BT distance is a little short, it starts to sound like a skipping cd if I'm too far away but no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Sauer

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough to listen while mowing the lawn.
customer_reviews.text: They could be a little louder for me, but then I am a little hard of hearing. Probably great for most folks.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Skinner

customer_reviews.title: DIED after 10 Months
customer_reviews.text: I loved these headphones, but they only lasted 10 months before they stopped powering on completely, even when charged. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: These don’t last
customer_reviews.text: These just ok earphones broke after one year of light use.
customer_reviews.author: Chandler P.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.  Breaks after 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect running headphones. I bought two pairs, they both broke after 3 weeks of use. Fix your hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Fandetti

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this as a gift to my wife. ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift to my wife. She opened it and it didn't work. It doesn't connect to Bluetooth...which is the only thing it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Better than Jaybirds
customer_reviews.text: tried Jaybirds. Those were garbage compared to these. Maybe they don't sound like Bose, but the fit phenomenally and stay snug during runs.
customer_reviews.author: Keith B.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Broke just after a year. Bluetooth didn’t always connect well
customer_reviews.author: Sophia W

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 days.
customer_reviews.text: These stopped working 3 days after I received them. They would not charge or turn on. They just died. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Dignan

customer_reviews.title: Painfully uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Painfully uncomfortable. The silicone (?) ear cushions provide *no* cushion, and the hard plastic ear-pieces quickly dig into your ears. This might be excusable, except that the cushions have a non-standard design, and third-party cushions can't be installed. The ear-pieces don't fill your ear canal at all, meaning that a huge amount of sound will leak in and out. This will be a pro for some and a con or others. I dislike this fact.
customer_reviews.author: Jerebear

customer_reviews.title: worst wourkout headphone
customer_reviews.text: I have bought the Phaiser 730: worst wourkout headphone: I have bought A Sony one but it blocks the ear canal and it hurts me. This is the best I have had. The fit is as an Airpod but for running and sports! And sound better though. Great
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge
customer_reviews.text: I got it, and it worked fine, but it charged once. Now it won't charge any more.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Unusably bad bluetooth performance
customer_reviews.text: Audio skips and skips and skips and skips if your phone is in my pocket, in my hand, or anywhere on/near my body. I just went through a warranty replacement with Urbanears and the replacement unit is exactly as bad. They didn't even want the first unit back -- just had me cut the earbud cables and send a picture to prove I destroyed them. It's too bad...I like the form factor and the urbanears silicone loop buds design is comfy for my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Bean

customer_reviews.title: Awful Bluetooth connectivity and barely work
customer_reviews.text: If it wasn't for how comfortable these headphones were these would get 1 star from me. When they work they work well, but it is so infrequent that that happens it's barely worth mentioning. The Bluetooth connection is absolutely awful; it's either extremely weak and your music cuts in and out or it keeps disconnecting entirely (after a couple weeks of use, disconnects are much more frequent). The connection is so weak that you can't even have your phone in your pocket while using these headphones without having this happen constantly. These headphones are garbage, especially considering how expensive they are. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Kenny

customer_reviews.title: AVOID! AVOID! AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: If you want the connectivity of a FM radio station while driving through a remote desert, these are the headphones for you! If you like a pinching sensation in your ear, these are for you! If you like a thin, tinny sound, these are for you! These headphones are LOUSY — and they have the customer service to match. They don't take returns. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Close, but not good enough.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes. Wore these for a good hour and had to take them off. No Bass and highs are washed out. After 45 min my ears started hurting from the tug of the coiled elastic. On the upside, these do stay in very well, they don't close the ear completely so you can hear outside noises, and you can take one bud off and it says on your head. I prefer quality then comfort. Neither of which this headset accomplish.
customer_reviews.author: Shai Perednik

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival ; Turns on, but not visible as a Bluetooth Device
customer_reviews.text: I have a half dozen Bluetooth devices and this headphone is the only one that is not visible/un-pairable to 2 laptops and 3 smartphones. On top of being DOA, the just so-so fit and finish as well as the flimsy construction that belies its high price made me decide to send it back for a full refund rather than a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: A NE Resident

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Loved the fit, audio quality and battery life but they broke really quickly. The light sensor shows that they are fully charged but they won't turn on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This bluetooth product was easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This bluetooth product was easy to set up. The two ear set makes a nice stereo sound, and the general sound quality is excellent. The curly wires make it a little different- sort of floppy, to wear. This works with a nice array of devices. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Lorel Shea

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: It's such a shame that it stopped working after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: hunterofphoenix

customer_reviews.title: Sound & Fit.... Top notch!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Urbanears for almost a couple months now. I cannot find a downside to these! Bluetooth capability in a small portable Headphone is amazing in it own right.... but the fit is phenomenal! Whether it's at the Gym or I'm out for a 10 mile run, the Stadion Active has not let me down once! I would highly recommend & (I have) Urbanears to anyone...
customer_reviews.author: Karissa Schoene

customer_reviews.title: Great for running!
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones for my runs! They allow me to remain aware of my surroundings while still enjoying my music. I used these for my Marine Corp Marathon. They worked the entire time even during the torrential rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These headphones stop working
customer_reviews.text: I have had three pairs of these (2nd and 3rd because they were replaced for free) and all three pairs have stopped working all together in the course of 1 year. The first pair lasted 10 months and pairs 2 and 3 barely lasted a month. They just stop turning on all. Overall I am very unhappy with these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mary H

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to use!
customer_reviews.text: The audio breaks out so much on these headphones that it's impossible to use them unless you're holding your phone up to them. No one should buy these...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BLUETOOTH HEADSET FOR WORKING OUT!!
customer_reviews.text: Best bluetooth headset I have tried (and i have tried quite a few). I love these for working out - they are so comfortable you can't even feel them in your ears after a 10-mile run, and the sound is also fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Courtney

customer_reviews.title: If you are active - walking, running, hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are active - walking, running, hiking, gym time and biking- these are for you! An amazingly elegant design that simply works. The headphones never come out or need adjusting.
customer_reviews.author: ESean

customer_reviews.title: Wireless headphones
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, and nothing is hanging to bother my neck while working out. The sound quality is amazing, and battery life is excellent (no need to charge daily with typical gym use - up to 7 hours of constant listening). They look very nice, and are adjustable to any head size.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Boswell

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headphone a few months ago, I love it. It's the best I ever have... Still working fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica T

product_meta.title: Urbanears Stadion Active Wireless Bluetooth Headset, Rush (04091871)
product_meta.description: Color:RushStadion is the performance-ready headset designed to fit as seamlessly as a faithful aerobics leotard. With its light and stretchy body, and no cords attached, stadion adapts to everything, from the unique shape of your head to your most intense workouts. With one less distraction in your headspace, there's nothing stopping you from taking your workout into the zone.
feature_bullets: Meet your perfect fit team: stretchy coils adapt to the shape of your head, and ear click technology ensures your earbuds stay firmly in place inside your ears
Bluetooth ready for cord-free listening and hands-free calls
A single charge gives up to 7 hours of playback time. Use the hidden micro USB port to recharge like a pro.
With all of the buttons you need around back, there's no reason to slow down. Use the 3-button control to click through your playlist, adjust volume, and pick up calls.
Built-in reflectors keep you extra visible during late night runs and 3 AM walks with the dog
Connectivity technology : Bluetooth 4.0. Battery play time: +7 hours

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.1 out of 5 stars136 ratings3.1 out of 5 stars
